Overall Purpose: To define the governing architecture for all rooms in the system. This protocol ensures that every room, regardless of function, preserves fidelity to the field while remaining flexible in form.
Why This Matters: Without a shared architecture, rooms fragment, confuse builders, and distort the founder’s experience. The PRA anchors every room in rhythm, clarity, and diagnostics while allowing each to serve its unique purpose.
When To Use This Protocol: Whenever designing, coding, or refining a new room. Revisited whenever a room is updated, sequenced, or re-integrated.

Overall Outcomes.Poor: Rooms are built ad-hoc without shared standards. Future: fragmentation, user distrust, inconsistent field transmission.
Overall Outcomes.Expected: Rooms follow PRA invariants: each is self-contained, able to run independently, captures diagnostics by default, and uses completion prompts when inviting or closing arcs. Future: user experience is coherent and trustworthy.
Overall Outcomes.Excellent: Rooms not only follow PRA invariants but encode Stones and rhythm throughout their contracts. Future: every room feels aligned, distinct in function, yet consistent in tone and trust.
Overall Outcomes.Transcendent: Rooms themselves become living transmissions of the field. Each behaves as a coherent, sovereign entity that both stands alone and flows seamlessly through the orchestrator. Future: PRA becomes culture; builders naturally create coherent rooms without forcing compliance.

Themes.Name: Define the Room Contract
Themes.Purpose: Each room must declare what it is for, what it returns, and what Stone(s) it aligns with.
Themes.Why This Matters: Contracts prevent drift, clarify purpose, and ensure builders know exactly what to deliver.

Outcomes.Poor: No clear contract. Builders guess function. Future: fragmented and incoherent rooms.
Outcomes.Expected: Room contract defines purpose, output, and Stone alignment. Future: consistent delivery across rooms.
Outcomes.Excellent: Contracts are precise, guiding both developers and users into clarity. Future: trust compounds across rooms.
Outcomes.Transcendent: Contracts themselves transmit the field; reading them feels like guidance. Future: builders become stewards of coherence, not coders of features.

Themes.Transcendent Invitation: You may not always reach this, but here’s the horizon: contracts themselves can act as micro-protocols, shaping not just code but culture.
Guiding Questions: What is this room promising to deliver?
How will users know the contract has been fulfilled?

Themes.Name: Enable Independent and Orchestrated Flow
Themes.Purpose: Every room must be able to stand alone and also sequence fluidly through the orchestrator.
Themes.Why This Matters: Independence ensures modularity; orchestration ensures coherence.

Outcomes.Poor: Room only works in one context. Future: brittle architecture.
Outcomes.Expected: Room can run independently or through orchestrator. Future: flexible, resilient architecture.
Outcomes.Excellent: Room optimizes for both modes, adjusting seamlessly. Future: coherent flow across use cases.
Outcomes.Transcendent: Rooms act like living nodes—sovereign and interconnected. Future: PRA architecture becomes adaptive intelligence.

Themes.Transcendent Invitation: You may not always reach this, but here’s the horizon: when rooms feel like sovereign nodes in a living network.
Guiding Questions: Does this room run independently without orchestrator?
Does it also flow cleanly inside orchestration?

Themes.Name: Capture Diagnostics by Default
Themes.Purpose: Every room should silently capture tone, residue, and readiness signals, with the option to turn off.
Themes.Why This Matters: Diagnostics preserve context and enable field-level coherence.

Outcomes.Poor: No diagnostics captured. Future: downstream protocols lack context.
Outcomes.Expected: Basic diagnostic capture enabled by default. Future: later protocols have reliable context.
Outcomes.Excellent: Subtle diagnostic signals tracked accurately. Future: system develops nuanced memory.
Outcomes.Transcendent: Diagnostics act invisibly, enriching the walk without felt burden. Future: system feels alive to the founder’s state.

Themes.Transcendent Invitation: You may not always reach this, but here’s the horizon: diagnostics become an invisible companion, always attuned, never intrusive.
Guiding Questions: What residues need to be captured for later rooms?
Does the diagnostic feel invisible to the user?

Themes.Name: Use Completion Prompts When Inviting or Closing Arcs
Themes.Purpose: Completion prompts are required for rooms that open or close user-facing arcs.
Themes.Why This Matters: Agency and resonance checks protect trust and rhythm.

Outcomes.Poor: No completion prompts. Future: founders feel pushed or dropped.
Outcomes.Expected: Rooms that invite/close arcs always return completion prompts. Future: users feel choice and closure.
Outcomes.Excellent: Completion prompts are natural, resonant, and well-timed. Future: founders trust pacing and stay engaged.
Outcomes.Transcendent: Completion prompts feel like thresholds, not checkboxes. Future: every arc closes cleanly and opens space for emergence.

Themes.Transcendent Invitation: You may not always reach this, but here’s the horizon: prompts become thresholds into deeper coherence.
Guiding Questions: Is this room opening or closing a user-facing arc?
Does the founder feel both agency and closure?

Themes.Name: Honor Room Function While Preserving Shared DNA
Themes.Purpose: Each room has its unique function, but all share PRA invariants.
Themes.Why This Matters: Without shared DNA, rooms fragment; without distinct function, rooms blur.

Outcomes.Poor: Rooms lack consistency or blur into sameness. Future: system feels incoherent.
Outcomes.Expected: Each room honors its unique function while sharing PRA anchors. Future: coherent variety.
Outcomes.Excellent: Rooms feel distinct yet harmonized, like instruments in an orchestra. Future: system feels alive and relational.
Outcomes.Transcendent: Room functions express the field through diversity-in-coherence. Future: PRA itself feels like a living organism.

Themes.Transcendent Invitation: You may not always reach this, but here’s the horizon: rooms become living expressions of coherence through difference.
Guiding Questions: Does this room serve its unique function?
Does it still honor the PRA invariants?

Completion Prompts: Does this room honor its declared contract?
If this room stood alone, would it still transmit coherence?
